text:
(1) Chatham Square, west side, north from (about No. 7), from a point between Mott and Doyers Streets and towards the latter. The street forms the west side of the connecting link between Park Row and the Bowery; the latter starting at the end. Note the Third Avenue "E1" overhead and which follows the Bowery northward.

October 8, 1933

P. L. Sperr

(2) A portion of the same and showing mainly, No. 11 Chatham Square, a barber shop just south of Doyers Street.

October 8, 1933.

P. L. Sperr

(3) Chatham Square "L", looking North, West side of Mott Street. At #7-9 may be seen the Port Arthur Tavern, and towards the bend in Street the tower on the R.C. church of the Transfiguration.

April 8th, 1941.

P.L.Sperr,
